title: Big Ideas and Small Stocks Pay Off at an Invesco Fund
text:
Profile An Invesco Manager Wins With Big Ideas, Small Stocks Juliet Ellis of the Invesco Small Cap Equity fund seeks companies with actual revenue and the potential for 25% gains in 18 months. By Sarah Max August 15, 2015 
When Juliet Ellis graduated from Indiana University in 1981, investing jobs in the Midwest were few and far between. So the economics major packed up her ’74 Fiat and drove to Texas. “Back then, Houston seemed like the land of opportunity,” says Ellis. 
Nearly 35 years later, Ellis, 56, is still in Houston, though not for lack of opportunity elsewhere. The chief investment officer of Invesco’s U.S. Growth Equities team, Ellis has put down roots—and built an impressive career—in the Lone Star State. An expert in small... Get The Full Story
